modules.description: Provides functions to read from and write to network flows, with explicit handling of errors and shutdown states. Operates on `flow` objects and custom error types, including `error` and `write_error`. Used to manage data transmission in network protocols, ensuring proper resource cleanup and error recovery.

Provides functions to read from and write to a flow, with explicit handling of errors and write errors through pretty-printers. Operates on `flow` objects and `Cstruct.t` buffers, supporting both single and multiple buffer writes. Used to manage network communication, ensuring proper closure and error recovery after I/O operations.

Provides HTTP/2 protocol parsing and serialization using Angstrom and Faraday, handling frames, streams, and connection management. Works with binary data, HTTP/2 headers, and stream state machines. Used to build compliant HTTP/2 servers and clients, enabling efficient, low-level network communication.

Handles HTTP/2 connection setup by binding a request and error handler to a socket, processing incoming streams with configured settings. Operates on socket type and H2 server connection structures. Used to establish a server that routes requests and manages errors during connection lifecycle.
